title: Logarithms
text: Since there is no easy way to get both powers to have the same base by rewriting in terms of their exponents, use logarithm operation to simplify.

title: Taking log of both sides
text: To simplify, take the natural log ln of both sides.

title: Power Rule of Logarithms
text: When taking the logarithm of a number with an exponent, the exponent can be moved in front of the logarithm and multiplied.

title: Distributing
text: After moving the $$x+2$$ and $$x$$ exponents in front of the ln terms, distribute the ln $$5$$ to both the $$x$$ and the $$2$$ in parentheses using the distributive law.

title: Isolating $$x$$
text: To move towards solving the equation, move all terms containing $$x$$ to one side and terms without $$x$$ to the other.

title: Solving for $$x$$
text: Once all the $$x$$ terms are on one side of the equation, factor out the $$x$$ from all the terms.

title: Law of Logs
text: Use the quotient rule to simplify when there are two logs subtracting each other.

title: Power Rule of Logarithms
text: A constant multiplied on the outside of a logarithm can be converted to be the exponent of the term within the logarithm.

title: Simplifying for $$x$$
text: To isolate $$x$$, divide the ln coefficient of the $$x$$ with the simplified ln expression on the other side of the equation.
